page.title: 15Longworth School
page.content: Children who were still going to school would do a small job to earn about enough to pay for two or three meals for themselves.The children would be quite well off if their father was a farmer because he would earn alot more money than anybody else.Chidren whose father wass a milkman would be lucky as well because sometimes the milkman would get one or two extra pints of milk if he worked hard enough. There were lots of other jobs to be done in the house like cleaning and polishing and washing and drying the clothes. It was much more difficult to wash clothes during the war it also took longer because we did not have washing machines.Washing machines were not invented until quite a few years after the war.
